item.title: All Wild Zone 19 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
In Pokemon Legends: Z-A , Wild Zone 19 is a large vineyard teeming with rare Pokemon with powerful evolutions. As the very last Wild Zone to become available before the final mission of the main story, players will want to take a look at all Pokemon available in this region in hopes of finding a new main party member.

This guide covers the location of all Pokemon found in Wild Zone 19, the time of day when they spawn in, as well as some tips on how to catch them easily. Here’s the breakdown.

Wild Zone 19 unlocks after players have completed Main Mission 30: Reaching Rank B.

All Wild Zone 19 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A & Where to Find Them

There are seven regular and two guaranteed Alpha Pokemon in Wild Zone 19 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . They are:

Clefairy

Furfrou

Drampa

Kangaskhan

Audino

Cleffa

Eevee

Alpha Clefairy

Alpha Furfrou

Kangaskhan Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A couple of Kangaskhan can be found right by Wild Zone 19’s northern entrance, and a few more can spawn near the southernmost part of Wild Zone 19, among the brambles. Kangaskhanite can be purchased from the Stone Emporium for 70,000 Poke Dollars.

Furfrou Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Furfrou can be found all over Wild Zone 19 during the day. They are scattered throughout the garden and will attack on sight.

All Furfrou forms can be unlocked via the Side Mission: Becoming a Furfrou Trainer.

Eevee Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Eevee can be found in the northwestern part of Wild Zone 19, among the bush vines, near the burnable brambles that contain the Hurricane TM. The Pokemon runs among the bushes and can be hard to keep track of if you don’t keep a close eye.

Drampa Location

  • Time: Day

A single Drampa can be found sitting in the middle of the Pavilion during the day. Drampanite can be purchased at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange for 360 Mega Shards.

Cleffa Location

  • Time: Night

Cleffa can be found near the stone Pavilion in the center of Wild Zone 19 at night. Cleffa evolves into Clefairy when it has high friendship.

Clefairy Location

  • Time: Night

Multiple Clefairy can be seen dancing in the moonlight on the Pavilion at night. They will keep dancing until disturbed.

Audino Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Audino can be found near the Pavilion where the Furfrou are, near the Eevee in the northern part of Wild Zone 19, and near the Kangaskhan next to the main entrance. They are skittish Pokemon that run away if approached. The only reliable ways to catch them are either by using a Quick Ball or by taking them out in one hit (OHKO).

Alpha Clefairy Location

  • Time: Night

A level 58 Alpha Clefairy dances alongside the other Clefairy on the Pavilion during nighttime. Clefairy evolves into Clefable using a Moon Stone. Clefablite becomes available at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange after Main Mission 31 for 240 Mega Shards.

Alpha Furfrou Location

  • Time: Day

A level 61 Alpha Furfrou roams the area near the Pavilion during the daytime. It is highly aggressive and will attack the trainer on sight.

57
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: How to Get Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo in Pokemon Legends Z-A (Side Mission 98)
item.description:
Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo is Side Mission 098 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , and, as its name suggests, it centers around catching a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo . While the requester indicates that such a Pokemon can be found in Wild Zone 15 at night, players may be confused about how to find one. This guide is here to alleviate that confusion, and it will help players get their hands on a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo in Pokemon Legends: Z-A .

While an Alpha Pumpkaboo will have an XL size classification, the requester states that she is not interested in Alpha Pokemon. In fact, "Jumbo," as it is used in this instance, is not even directly connected to size, and it is possible to find a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo with an M or L classification.

How to Get Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Hang Out Until Nightfall

As noted, Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo can appear at night , and players can use Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's pass time feature to instantly skip to that part of the day. For the uninitiated, time can be passed by interacting with a bench, selecting the "kill some time here" option, and agreeing to hang out until nightfall. Notably, there are two benches next to Wild Zone 15's southwestern entrance, and this is a great place to pass time while working on this side mission.

Check Pumpkaboo in Wild Zone 15

Once night descends, players should fast travel to Wild Zone 15's southeast entrance, enter the Wild Zone, and walk slowly towards its northwest entrance. As players travel in that direction, they will pass several Pumpkaboos, and they should listen to the sound that the Pokemon make just before attacking. Indeed, Pumpkaboos can make two different sounds, and those sounds are the key to determining which ones are Jumbo Variety.

More specifically, Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboos make a lower sound than their non-jumbo counterparts. The preceding video demonstrates the difference between those sounds, and Pokemon Legends: Z-A players should take these actions to catch the Pokemon that they need:

  1. As you walk through Wild Zone 15, listen to the sound each Pumpkaboo makes before attacking.
  2. If a Pumpkaboo makes the standard sound, catch it or defeat it.
  3. If a Pumpkaboo makes the lower sound, indicating that it is Jumbo Variety, catch it.
  4. If you get rid of all the Pumpkaboos in Wild Zone 15 without finding a Jumbo Variety, wait for them to respawn. This should take approximately four minutes.
  5. Repeat the previous steps until you find a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo.

Players may not find a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo during their first night in Wild Zone 15, and they may need to pass time on a bench again. It is also worth mentioning that it is helpful to get rid of the Alpha Gourgeist in the middle of the zone, as doing so makes it much easier to hear the Pumpkaboos.

Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo Rewards in Pokemon Legends Z-A

Once a player has caught a Jumbo Variety Pumpkaboo, they can return to the requester and deliver the Pokemon to receive the following rewards:

  • 6,000 Poke Coins
  • 5x Seed of Mastery
  • 2x Rare Candy
57
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: All Wild Zone 18 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Before the post-game, Wild Zone 18 is the best location to obtain high-level Dragon-type Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , allowing players to prepare for the ultimate confrontation that comes at the end of the game’s main story. However, some of the inhabitants of this area can be surprisingly elusive if you don’t know where to look.

This guide covers the location of all Pokemon found in Wild Zone 18, the time of day when they spawn, as well as the best strategies for catching them. Here’s the breakdown.

Wild Zone 18 unlocks after players have completed Main Mission 30 : Reaching Rank B.

All Wild Zone 18 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A & Where to Find Them

There are six regular and two guaranteed Alpha Pokemon in Wild Zone 18 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . They are:

Bagon

Altaria

Swablu

Fennekin

Noibat

Noivern

Alpha Salamence

Alpha Lopunny

Bagon Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Two Bagon can be found inside the small garden surrounded by metal fencing, in the center of Wild Zone 18.

Swablu Location

  • Time: Day

Swablu can be found on the rooftops of Wild Zone 18. However, it is impossible to climb up to this location from the inside. To reach the rooftops, climb the scaffolding that’s directly outside the southwestern entrance, and you’ll reach the upper gate. There will be a large group of Swablu nesting just inside.

Altaria Location

  • Time: Day

Altaria is found on the rooftops near the Swablu. Climb the metal scaffolding just outside Wild Zone 18’s southwestern gate to get here. Altarianite is a reward for defeating the Rogue Mega Altaria in Main Mission 28.

Noibat Location

  • Time: Night

Three Noibat spawn on the rooftops of Wild Zone 18 at night, replacing the Swablu that appear during the day.

Noivern Location

  • Time: Night

A single Noivern appears on the rooftops of Wild Zone 18 at night at the same spot as the Altaria.

Fennekin Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Enter Wild Zone 18 from the rooftop gate (explained in the Swablu section) and climb up the ladder right in front of you to find Fennekin. This is a skittish Pokemon, which means it will run away immediately if it spots you. Use a Quick Ball right away to catch it.

If you fail to catch Fennekin, you can rest at the bench just outside Wild Zone 18’s rooftop gate to pass the time and have it respawn.

Alpha Salamence Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A level 61 Alpha Salamence is found directly in the middle of Wild Zone 18, next to the fenced-off garden that is surrounded by tall buildings. Salamencite can be purchased at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange for 360 Mega Shards after Main Mission 31.

Alpha Lopunny Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A level 56 Alpha Lopunny is found right next to the southern entrance to Wild Zone 18, underneath the metal scaffolding. Use Fighting-type moves to take it out easily. Lopunnite can be purchased at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange for 180 Mega Shards.

57
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Has Officially Beaten Arceus
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A has eclipsed its predecessor, Pokemon Legends: Arceus , in Japan's opening week sales numbers. While the sales figures for Pokemon Legends: Z-A are divided between two different Nintendo consoles, the combined figures have managed to edge out Arceus ' opening-week sales by a narrow margin.

Launched on October 16, the second game in the Legends series has received a mixed response that doesn't seem to have adversely affected its sales. While professional critics have given it an 82 percent approval rating on OpenCritic, post-launch review-bombing of Pokemon Legends: Z-A has driven down its user score to 40 percent, with negative reactions frequently citing a perceived laziness in game design.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Beats Arceus in Opening-Week Sales

According to Japanese sales figures released by Famitsu for the week of October 13-19, Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's two console-specific versions held the top two spots on the sales chart for their debut week, with a combined sales total that exceeds 1.485 million. These numbers are divided between the Nintendo Switch version, which racked up more 872,000 in sales, and the Nintendo Switch 2 version, for which nearly 613,000 sales were recorded. Combined, those figures beat the opening week sales numbers that Pokemon Legends: Arceus posted following its release in January 2022 by about 60,000 units. At the time of Arceus ' launch, that was a significant figure, as only Animal Crossing: New Horizons had achieved more success on Nintendo Switch during its first week on the market.

Those sales figures not only serve as a tribute to the popularity of the Pokemon Legends games but as a very positive financial sign for Game Freak and Nintendo. Developed with a reported budget of around two billion yen, or about $13 million, one mid-October estimate predicted that Pokemon Legends: Z-A only needed to sell 200,000 copies to break even. Having already met that goal more than sevenfold in Japan alone, according to Famitsu's figures, it can be estimated that the latest Legends title has already generated more than $96.5 million in net earnings tied to that region. Even more impressive is that Pokemon Legends: Z-A was released during the middle of Famitsu's recorded sales week, so those numbers actually only reflect four days of sales in addition to any pre-orders.

Among the other high-ranking games on the list, Mario Kart World 's sales continue to trickle in despite it trailing Mario Kart 8 Deluxe in July. The sales figures put it in third place for the week, with weekly sales of close to 56,000 units and all-time Japanese sales in excess of 1.9 million. Rounding out the top five are PlayStation 5 exclusive Ghost of Yotei , which recorded close to 19,000 in new sales, and Nintendo's bundled Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 on Switch, for which more than 11,000 new units were sold.

57
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: All Wild Zone 20 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Wild Zone 20 is the very last area where players can find wild Pokemon to fill out their Pokedex in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , and it is bigger than anything else players will have encountered previously.

This guide covers how to find all Pokemon in Wild Zone 20, the correct time of day to look for them, as well as some tips and tricks for getting the most out of the area. Here’s the breakdown.

Wild Zone 20 unlocks after players have completed the main story of Pokemon Legends: Z-A in Main Mission 37, and have reached the post-game.

All Wild Zone 20 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A & Where to Find Them

There are 15 Pokemon in Wild Zone 20 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . They are:

Malamar

Dragalge

Hippowdon

Lucario

Roselia

Gardevoir

Scrafty

Garbodor

Aggron

Charmander

Tepig

Squirtle

Totodile

Bulbasaur

Chikorita

Malamar Location

  • Time: Day/Night

There is a deep pool of water with a wooden bridge over it in the southernmost part of Wild Zone 20. Two Malamar can be found floating on top of the water. This spawn point is shared with Dragalge.

Dragalge Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Dragalge appear floating on top of the deep pool of water with the wooden bridge in Wild Zone 20. If you see Malamar here instead, reset the zone by fast traveling to it.

Hippowdon Location

  • Time: Day/Night

There are two Hippowdon spawns in Wild Zone 20. One can be found directly in front of the southern entrance, and the second can be found directly opposite the western entrance.

Lucario Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Two Lucario can be seen on the sandy area with the large rock and the trees between the concrete pavement.

Roselia Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Roselia can be found roaming the area between the bushes in the eastern part of Wild Zone 20.

Gardevoir Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Two Gardevoir can be found in the garden strip surrounding the Prism Tower. One can be seen in the northeastern part, right next to the north entrance, and the other can be found in the eastern section, right in front of that entrance.

Gardevoir are skittish, meaning they will disappear as soon as they see you approach. The best method of catching them is to sneak up from behind and throw a Quick Ball.

Scrafty Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Scrafty can appear in the construction zone in the top left corner of Wild Zone 20, with all the rubble and metal parts. Scraftinite can be purchased at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange for 240 Mega Shards after Main Mission 31.

Garbodor Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A few Garbodor appear fairly often in the construction area in Wild Zone 20, in between the containers.

Aggron Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A single Aggron appears in the construction area in the northwestern section of Wild Zone 20. It is not a guaranteed spawn, but relatively common. Aggronite can be purchased at the Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange for 360 Mega Shards after Main Mission 20.

Charmander Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Charmander can be found in one of five possible locations (shown above). As a Fire-type Pokemon, Charmander does not like to go in the water.

The five starter Pokemon available in Wild Zone 20 all share five possible spawn locations. If you don’t find the one you’re looking for, reset the zone by fast traveling and try again.

Tepig Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Tepig can be found in one of five possible locations (shown above). It is relatively common among all the other starters available in the area, and you’ll likely find him fairly easily.

Totodile Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Totodile can be found in one of five possible locations (shown above). It also sometimes jumps into the water alongside the Dragalge and Malamar, or in the shallow pool that circles the entire Wild Zone.

Bulbasaur Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Bulbasaur can be found in one of five possible locations (shown above). It can typically be found sitting near the bushes. Its appearances are relatively rare when compared to the other starters.

Chikorita Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Chikorita is the most common starter in Wild Zone 20 after Tepig, spawning in five possible locations in the area.

Squirtle Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Squirtle can spawn in five possible locations in Wild Zone 20 (shown above). It is the rarest starter to find in the area, comparable to Charmander, and has a very low catch rate. Using Ultra Balls until it gets angry is recommended to maximize your chances of capture.

Alpha Pokemon in Wild Zone 20

There are two Alpha Pokemon spawn slots in Wild Zone 20, directly in the middle of the area, underneath the broken Prism Tower. Quite a few Pokemon can occupy these slots, meaning every time the area resets, you’re likely to see a new pair of Alpha Pokemon roaming the pit in the middle.

So far, we’ve seen the following Alpha Pokemon make an appearance here:

  • Gengar
  • Altaria
  • Skarmory
  • Metagross
  • Carbink
  • Barbaracle
  • Vanilluxe
  • Hippowdon
  • Gardevoir
  • Victreebel
  • Aegislash
  • Machamp
  • Roserade

From our testing, it appears that only fully evolved Pokemon that are a part of the Kalos Pokedex can appear as their Alpha variants in Wild Zone 20. Notably, even trade-exclusive evolutions like Gengar and Alakazam can be found as Alpha Pokemon here, making it an excellent post-game location to fill out your Pokedex.

57
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A
